1.hint: I'm going to assume you didn't realize this was a hint button. You do not need a hint for this.

completionMessage.message: Well done, Anshul. Even a code *bonobo* could have figured that one out. But a deal's a deal; I'll let one of your friends go. Sounds like they have something to say to you:
completionMessage.postAudioMessage: Whoops, wrong audio file. I'm so sorry. There's so many and some are unlabeled, it's hard to keep track. I promise I'm not laughing, this is very serious business.

completionMessage.message: Very impressive for a guy who gets butterflies in his stomach when he sees a memory address. While I would love nothing more than to rick roll you a second time, we criminal masterminds have standards. Perhaps you recognize this voice?
completionMessage.postAudioMessage: HAHAHAHAHA! It was even funnier the second time! You should have seen your face! Go ahead with the next level while I keep replaying that moment in my head. Oh, and watch out for red herrings.

3.levelName: feels like we only go backwards
3.hint: Wouldn't it be great if those pegs were just lined up the opposite way?

completionMessage.message: Excellent- I hope you enjoyed my little transform-origin trick. I'm rather pleased with your progress, so I'll let one of your friends go. I know what you're thinking, but I believe comedy comes in twos, so don't worry about Mr. Astley; no tricks this time.
completionMessage.postAudioMessage: How nice. Honestly, that was the longest three minutes of my life. You fraternize with these people? Anyway, I have another level prepared for you.

4.hint: "If the margin is on the left, attack from the right." -Sun Tsu

completionMessage.message: Spectacular! I would have never thought to do that. That is, if my oversized brain had been replaced with three pounds of gravel. Still, not bad for a C head. Here's another one of your friends:
completionMessage.postAudioMessage: Great, so when *you* kidnap someone for their birthday, you're a hero, but when *I* kidnap your friends for your birthday, I'm a villain. Anyway, enjoy this next level. It's quite simple, really- just add one property.

5.hint: That CSS Editor is good for more than editing styles.

completionMessage.message: I hope you didn't spend longer than 72 seconds on that one, because that's how long it took my 3-year-old daughter Cassie to solve. Regardless, I'm impressed by your creativity; not many C developers make it past that one. I guess I'll let... ~you~ go.
completionMessage.postAudioMessage: Aw, wasn't that sweet? Rose-colored glasses are an amazing thing. Alright, enough of that, more CSS!

6.hint: That overflow property is a hint in and of itself.

completionMessage.message: Nicely done- you know, if it weren't for all the overwhelming evidence that you don't understand or enjoy CSS, I might have mistaken you for a front end engineer. Let's set another one of your friends free.
completionMessage.postAudioMessage: Once again, your friends thank you for making them suffer, but me? You know, there's an old saying about goats and bridges... ah, you wouldn't understand. Go on, then.

7.hint: Honestly, I don't have a great hint for this one. Try being better?

t0.text: now i can taunt you from within the level itself!

completionMessage.message: Why, it seems you have literally used my words against me! Hahaha! Not quite as funny as the second Rick Roll, but we UI designers have to take pleasure in what we can. Anyway, here, you get this friend back:
completionMessage.postAudioMessage: Honestly, that guy was my favorite so far, sad I had to let him go. Cool guy, that kid. Why can't you be more like him? Okay, have fun with this next level. See you *real* soon.

8.hint: Note the different font size units. I wonder why that might be...

t0.text: time for a brief villain monologue

t1.text: you see, it all began with my father. he- aaaand you're not listening

completionMessage.message: Ah, I knew I should have saved my monologue for later. I guess I just have a lot of unresolved trauma to unpack. You see, it all started with my father; you could say I didn't exactly *align* with his expectations for an ideal son...
completionMessage.postAudioMessage: ...and so, to save everything I held dear, I had no choice but to become the Justifier. Do you see now? Why I had to do it? Oh, you weren't listening again- no, it's fine. Enjoy the next level.

9.hint: PEG B probably isn't in-line with what you think it is. Look more carefully at its positioning properties.

completionMessage.message: So you see, Cassie, margin-top doesn't affect non-replaced inline- oh! You're back! I, uh, honestly thought that would be the last of you. Well, haha, well done! Let's see... this one's been getting on my nerves, they can go free.
completionMessage.postAudioMessage: Although your friends are slowly being saved, your integrity as a systems engineer is lost! Will they even recognize the thing you've become? Will- no, Cassie, no uppies right now. I'm in the middle of- yeah, Anshul, just go to the next one.

10.hint: Good luck clearing this level, blockhead.

t0.text: I thought I would take a moment to read to you some scripture. The following is a reading from the MDN Web Doc. Ahem. "The float CSS property places an element on the left or right side of its container, allowing text and inline elements to wrap around it. The element is removed from the normal flow of the page, though still remaining a part of the flow (in contrast to absolute positioning)." Ah, the great mystery of flow. We don't understand it, yet we believe in it nonetheless.

completionMessage.message: Splendid! You're shaping up to be one of the best code monkeys I've trained; I'm very impressed by your progress. Here's another one of the lackeys you call friends.
completionMessage.postAudioMessage: Wow. Watching a cat get run over in San Francisco. How original. Seriously, where do you find these people? Ok, next level, next level... I swear I have plenty of torturous levels left, they're just... a bit disorganized, is all. Ah, here's one! Prepare to meet your demise!

11.hint: Wait, where'd it go? Have you checked under there?

completionMessage.message: Okay, okay, I know that wasn't exactly my most ~ingenious~ level so far. I just... you know... it's hard to *satisfy* you these days, you just solve all my levels and... I just don't feel like you appreciate all the effort I put into these. I just want you to appreciate me like... like your friends appreciate you.
completionMessage.postAudioMessage: Hey, sorry about all that stuff earlier. Being a cssupervillain comes with a lot of added stress. But my moment of weakness has passed. This next level will fry what few neurons you have left!

12.hint: Don't be afraid to get cramped.

completionMessage.message: Huh. That level was supposed to be unsolveable. It didn't occur to me to- I mean, it's just not good practice to- anyway, as we agreed, here's another one of your friends. This one has even more problematic opinions than I do.
completionMessage.postAudioMessage: Yes, yes, very nice. Look, I didn't want to have to do this, Anshul, but it seems you're forcing my hand. Gentlemen, bring out... the Gauntletâ„¢.
